item.title: Becoming a Non-Passive Reader
item.description: Problem You read a great book, highlighted your favorite quotes, but a few months later, you forgot most of the things in the book and never revisit the notes you took. Does that happen to you? Well, it happens to me all the time. I can vaguely remember the gist and my impressions of the books I’ve read, and overtime, I return everything back to my “teachers”. I used read a lot of random books, especially detective novels, as a kid until school/textbook reading occupied most of my time.
